meanings.definition: A person or thing that smooths.
meanings.sent1: The smoothers in the factory made sure the surfaces were flat.
meanings.sent2: I used a smoother to even out the cake frosting.
meanings.sent3: The little robot was the best of all the smoothers at tidying up the toys.
meanings.sent4: Her calming presence acted as a smoother in the tense situation.
meanings.sent5: The gentle waves of the ocean acted as natural smoothers of the sand.

meanings.definition: A tool or device used for smoothing.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter's smoother helped in sanding the wood smoothly.
meanings.sent2: She reached for the smoother to make the fabric wrinkle-free.
meanings.sent3: The automatic floor smoother glided effortlessly across the room.
meanings.sent4: The smoother in his hand felt like a magic wand, transforming rough surfaces.
meanings.sent5: The ice skater's movements were as graceful as a smoother on glass.

meanings.definition: Something that makes smooth or even.
meanings.sent1: The new paint was a great smoother for the old walls.
meanings.sent2: Using a hair smoother made her hair silky and shiny.
meanings.sent3: The music played by the band acted as a smoother for the awkward silence.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a smoother that eased the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The warm sunlight acted as a natural smoother on the cold pavement.
